intro: Afrodaphne euryneura, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and usually elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, often used in ornamental horticulture. The bark is smooth and light grey, with a pleasant aromatic scent when crushed.
